warscrolls.name: Acolyte Globadiers
warscrolls.fluff: The Acolyte Globadiers of the Clans Skryre are tinkerers and artificers, miners and munitions carriers. They are a step above the thrall-rats that toil on the production lines or serve as fodder for weapons testing, and they scheme constantly about attaining the status of Warlock. The masters of the Clans Skryre are well aware of this, and they are little disposed to acquiring new rivals.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Weapon Team, Champion, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Hidden Weapon Team
abilities.lore: Skryre weapon teams often lurk amidst larger formations.
abilities.effect: While this unit is within the combat range of a friendly Clanrats unit that has 5 or more models, and there are no other friendly WEAPON TEAM units within that unit’s combat range, this unit is not visible to enemy units more than 13" away.

abilities.name: Gas Clouds
abilities.lore: Poisoned wind globes are crystal orbs filled with deadly warp-gas that can engulf and lethally transmute an enemy regiment.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to the Damage characteristic of this unit’s Poisoned Wind Globes for attacks that target an enemy unit that has 10 or more models.

warscrolls.name: Arch-Warlock
warscrolls.fluff: At the head of every Skyre clan stands an Arch-Warlock. They are the masters of the various schools of lethal science practised by their clan, and they have personally overseen the creation of all manner of temperamental, but utterly deadly, techno-arcane superweapons. An Arch-Warlock's mind is a thing of whirring brass gears, constantly churning out new schematics of death.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Wizard (1), Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Overseers of the Enginecovens
abilities.lore: The Arch-Warlocks of the Clans Skryre command their enginecovens with a blend of deadly efficiency and overt sadism.
abilities.effect: If a friendly SKRYRE unit wholly within 13" of this unit uses the 'Covering Fire' command, no command points are spent.

warscrolls.name: Bell of Doom
warscrolls.fluff: The Bell of Doom is a thing of ruinous sorcery. The ratmen have long been fascinated with such instruments, viewing them as relics charged with the ruinous will of the Great Horned Rat. Skaven sorcerers possess the means to render this belief a reality; by ringing a small hand-bell of refined warpstone and hissing the thirteen incantations of Kavzar, they can shape the aether into a clanging tool of apocalypse. Each peal from a Bell of Doom shakes the very fabric of creation. The earth splits asunder, mortar shakes loose from walls and proud statues topple. What remains is ruin, fit only for vermin to swarm over.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Fly, Ward (6+), Chaos, Skaven

abilities.name: Toll of Doom
abilities.lore: The dreadful ringing of the Bell of Doom fills the minds of the Skaven’s foes with a deep despair.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from wound rolls for attacks that target friendly SKAVEN INFANTRY units while they are wholly within 13" of this MANIFESTATION.

warscrolls.name: Brood Terror
warscrolls.fluff: Amongst the most hideous aberrations of Skaven fleshcraft, a Brood Terror is created when a Master Moulder is stitched into a monstrous form. These twin-headed titans lurch between bouts of low cunning and bestial rage. Surrounded by clouds of mutagenic fog, they lumber forth with an ungainly but definite purpose, From one mutilated limb hangs a hooked flail that the Terror uses to drag its prey closer, whereupon the victim is bathed in the fires that leap from its warpflame scourger or vivisected by clusters of swift knife-arms.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Monster, Chaos, Skaven, Moulder

abilities.name: Regenerating Terror
abilities.lore: Brood Terrors are a nightmare of mutation and overwhelming strength.
abilities.effect: Heal (D6) this unit.

abilities.name: Warpstone Fumes
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: The belching, flesh-twisting smoke that clings to a Brood Terror obscures the clawpacks from view.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, for the rest of the turn, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by enemy units while they are within 6" of this unit.

warscrolls.name: Clanrats
warscrolls.fluff: Clanrats are the unwashed masses of the Clans Verminus. They are the dregs of the ratmen’s society, considered utterly disposable by their masters. No matter how many are spitted on pikes, crushed by bludgeons or riddled with arrows, the tide of mangy fur never seems to slacken. In turn, they fight with whatever rusted spears and blades they can scrounge up, as well as their own claws and teeth when necessary. Clanrats are nimble but undisciplined soldiers and, like most Skaven, are prone to wavering at the slightest threat. Only when sufficiently motivated by fear, hunger or overwhelming advantage can they be trusted to press the advance – but when they do, they can reduce entire armies to piles of gnawed bones.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Musician (1/20), Standard Bearer (1/20), Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Seething Swarm
abilities.lore: Clanrats overwhelm their enemies with their seemingly endless numbers – biting, stabbing and trampling their own fallen beneath their bloody claws.
abilities.effect: You can return D3 slain models to this unit.

warscrolls.name: Clawlord
warscrolls.fluff: Clawlords command from the very back ranks - the most honourable of all positions within Skaven society. After all, why should a leader sully their own blade with violence when there are plenty of minions able to die on their behalf? Clawlords expend the lives of their underlings freely, safe in the knowledge that there are always more where they came from. The wisest amongst them also make sure that they always have an escape route to paw - even if they must cut through enemies and allies alike in the process.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Gnash-gnaw On Their Bones!
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a FIGHT ability for this unit
abilities.lore: At a Clawlord’s command, their minions hurl themselves at the foe.
abilities.effect: Pick a friendly non-HERO VERMINUS INFANTRY unit that has not used a FIGHT ability this turn and is within this unit’s combat range to be the target. The target can be picked to use a FIGHT ability immediately after the FIGHT ability used by this unit has been resolved.

abilities.name: Cornered Rat
abilities.lore: A Clawlord in fear for their life fights with rabid ferocity.
abilities.effect: While this unit is damaged, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of its Warpforged Blade.

warscrolls.name: Clawlord on Gnaw-beast
warscrolls.fluff: The title of Clawlord is not awarded through ceremony; it must be seized via cunning and violence. Clawlords of sufficient prestige may acquire a freakish mount known as a Gnaw-beast. These gangly-limbed and whipcord-fast horrors are bred by the Clans Moulder to possess a self-destructively swift metabolism. No matter how voraciously it feeds, the black hunger pains the Gnaw-beast constantly, granting it a frenzy that only fear of its master can curb.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Cavalry, Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Cruel Commander
abilities.lore: The Clawlord strikes down one of their underlings to show their cruel power and then, with shrieks and hissed threats, commands their swarming underlings to overrun the foe.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly non-HERO VERMINUS INFANTRY unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Inflict 1 mortal damage on the target. Then, add 5 to the target’s control score until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: Cornered Rat
abilities.lore: A Clawlord in fear for their life fights with rabid ferocity.
abilities.effect: While this unit is damaged, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of its Warpforged Halberd.

warscrolls.name: Deathmaster
warscrolls.fluff: Deathmasters are singularly adept killers. A significant part of their training centres around defying the self-interested Skaven mindset and honing the ability to set aside their own ambitions for the sake of their mission. Skulking unseen amidst the melee, Deathmasters wait for their target to leave themselves exposed before striking with great acrobatic ferocity, wielding an array of esoteric weapons such as warpstone throwing stars and weeping blades that can kill with the lightest scratch.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Eshin

abilities.name: Shadowy Killers
abilities.lore: Ulguan illusions and other tools of misdirection shroud Deathmasters in perpetual darkness, keeping them from harm.
abilities.effect: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack that targets this unit is 1-4, the attack fails and the attack sequence ends.

abilities.name: Running Death
abilities.lore: Deathmasters lead only the nimblest Eshin agents to war.
abilities.effect: While friendly ESHIN units are wholly within 13" of this unit, they can use SHOOT and/or CHARGE abilities even if they used a RUN ability in the same turn.

warscrolls.name: Doom-Flayers
warscrolls.fluff: The whirling globes of death known as Doom-Flayers were originally designed as mining devices. It speaks to the Skaven mindset that an enterprising Warlock observed the devastation they wrought on rock and immediately began considering military applications. Doom-Flayers now trundle along behind massed formations of Clanrats and Stormvermin, their operators revving the warp-engine impatiently. Eventually, their destructive urges overtake them and they gun the acceleration to churn a great furrow forward through the earth.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Whirling Doom
abilities.lore: Doom-Flayers crash into the foe with hellish results, leaving a trail of gore in their wake.
abilities.declare: If this unit charged this phase, pick an enemy unit within 1" of it to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Doomwheel
warscrolls.fluff: Many uncanny war engines have emerged from the forges of the Clans Skryre, but the Doomwheels are arguably the most bizarre. These contraptions can appear almost amusing to incredulous foes; resembling giant wheels, they roll forwards at an unsteady pace. Yet amusement gives way to terror as the Doomwheel picks up speed, erratic blasts of warp lightning leaping from the ruinous realmstone crystals affixed to prongs on its flanks. Any caught in its path will be either blasted to blackened corpses or simply ground to bloody smears.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Rolling Doom
abilities.lore: A Doomwheel will mercilessly crush anything in its path.
abilities.effect:
This unit can move a distance up to its Move characteristic. This unit can pass through other models and the combat ranges of enemy units, but it cannot end that move in combat.

Then, pick up to 3 enemy units that this unit passed across during that move to be the targets. Roll a D3 for each target. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

Designer’s Note: This unit can use this ability even if it is in combat.

warscrolls.name: Gnawhole
warscrolls.fluff: Gnawholes are undeniably a boon when they emerge upon a battlefield. They allow a seemingly endless stream of Skaven reinforcements to be funnelled from the depths of Blight City, and if a pack of ratmen are feeling especially brave, they might elect to plunge into one and hope to emerge from another, outflanking the enemy in the process. The unstable nature of the gnawholes, however, means that delving into them in this way often sees a Skaven accidentally blasted to ashes, unintentionally burrow through a volcano or simply vanish without a trace.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Faction Terrain, Chaos, Skaven

abilities.name: Tunnels Through Reality
abilities.lore: The Skaven can move through gnawholes to invade any corner of the Mortal Realms.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly SKAVEN unit that is not in combat and is wholly within 6" of this terrain feature to be the target.
abilities.effect: Remove the target from the battlefield and set it up again wholly within 6" of another friendly Gnawhole and more than 9" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Volatile Ground
abilities.lore: Crackling warp lightning skitters around the ruptured rocks that ring this tear in reality.
abilities.effect:
Models can pass through this terrain feature but cannot be set up on or end moves on any part of this terrain feature.

Each time an enemy unit ends a move that passed through or across this terrain feature, roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on that unit equal to the roll.

abilities.name: The Endless Vermintide
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Your Turn
abilities.lore: Swarms of vermin scurry forth from the gnawhole, overwhelming the enemy lines.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly non-HERO SKAVEN INFANTRY unit that has been destroyed to be the target.
abilities.effect: Set up a replacement unit with half the number of models from the target unit (rounding up) wholly within 6" of a friendly Gnawhole and more than 3" from all enemy units.

warscrolls.name: Grey Seer
warscrolls.fluff: Most devious of all Skaven are the Grey Seers. These are the agents of the Masterclan who work to manipulate Skaven society from the shadows. With a hissed incantation and flick of their claws, a Seer can summon storms of warp lightning, blast enemies with withering energy or teleport great distances in a blink. Grey Seers also possess a natural affinity for warpstone; their staffs of office are imbued with chunks of the corruptive realmstone, and many will consume shards of the substance to fuel their ruinous spellcraft.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Wizard (1), Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Masterclan

abilities.name: Warpstone Shards
abilities.lore: Grey Seers consume potentially lethal shards of warpstone to enhance their spellcasting.
abilities.effect:
The next time you make a casting roll for this unit this phase, roll 3D6 instead of 2D6. This roll cannot be rerolled or modified.

If the casting roll is 13, the spell is successfully cast and cannot be unbound. After the effect of that spell has been resolved, inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit.

If the casting roll is not 13, remove 1 dice of your choice from the casting roll and use the remaining 2D6 as the casting roll.

warscrolls.name: Grey Seer on Screaming Bell
warscrolls.fluff: Of all the strange constructs fashioned by the Skaven, Screaming Bells are perhaps the most diabolical. From a rickety conveyance of wood hangs a great brass bell, studded with warpstone and marked with glowing runes. A Grey Seer, a prophet of the Horned Rat, scrabbles across the bell, hurling commands at their minions below and conjuring storms of magic from their bizarre pulpit. Then the device rings, and all hell breaks loose.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, War Machine, Wizard (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Masterclan

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, the Attacks characteristic of its Crushing Bulk is 4.

abilities.name: Altar of the Horned Rat
abilities.lore: Throngs of rat-thralls swarm around this mighty construct in battle and will sell their lives to see it from harm.
abilities.effect: Friendly SKAVEN INFANTRY units have WARD (6+) while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

abilities.name: Cracks Call
abilities.lore: Harnessing the thunderous peals of the Screaming Bell, the Grey Seer channels a sorcerous blast into the ground beneath the foe’s feet. Gaping chasms yawn wide, sending screaming victims vanishing into the depths.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit that does not have FLY and is within 13" of this unit to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: If the casting roll exceeds the target’s Move characteristic, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the difference between the casting roll and its Move characteristic.

abilities.name: Peal of Doom
abilities.lore: The ominous tolling of a Screaming Bell resounds above the clamour of battle, crying out ‘Doom! Doom! Doom!’
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice and apply the corresponding effect:

1 - Magical Backlash
Inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit.

2-4 - Wall of Unholy Sound
Until the start of your next turn, subtract 1 from hit rolls for combat attacks made by enemy units while they are within 13" of this unit.

5-6 - Apocalyptic Doom
Roll a D3 for each enemy unit within 13" of this unit. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on that unit equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Gutter Runners
warscrolls.fluff: Emerging from positions of concealment at the enemy’s flanks and rear, Gutter Runners fall upon their victims in a storm of flashing blades, hurtling throwing stars and viciously bared fangs.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Eshin

abilities.name: Sneaky Infiltrators
abilities.lore: Gutter Runners are masters of stealth and can sneak up on almost anyone.
abilities.effect: While each model in this unit is within 1" of any terrain features, this unit cannot be targeted by shooting attacks unless the attacking model is within 9" of it.

abilities.name: Deliver The Killing Strike
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Gutter Runners will wait for the perfect opening before unleashing a flurry of deadly attacks.
abilities.effect: Add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s Punch Dagger and Blade for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Hell Pit Abomination
warscrolls.fluff: Named for the gruesome subterranean laboratories in which they are crafted, Hell Pit Abominations are the pinnacle of the Master Moulders' sciences. An Abomination is created by melding and mutating the flesh of plentiful hapless subjects as well as employing warpstone and other, more secretive arts. Foes are soon overwhelmed by an avalanche of flailing limbs - many of which sport various murderous 'upgrades'. Yet the insensate bulk of the Abomination remains its greatest weapon, capable of breaking a flank single-handedly.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Monster, Chaos, Skaven, Moulder

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, the Attacks characteristic of its Gnashing Teeth and Flailing Fists is 8.

abilities.name: Regenerating Monstrosity
abilities.lore: Hell Pit Abominations are notoriously difficult to slay and can even regrow severed limbs.
abilities.effect: Heal (D6) this unit.

abilities.name: Avalanche of Flesh
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: A Hell Pit Abomination can rear up to its fullest height before crashing back to the ground, crushing foes beneath its sickening bulk.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy INFANTRY unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, roll a dice for each model in the target unit. For each 5+, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Too Horrible To Die
abilities.lore: As it twitches in its shuddering death throes, there is a chance that either the Abomination’s unholy metabolism will restart one of its many foul hearts or its carcass will disgorge the revolting tide of parasitic rats that had been gnawing upon its innards.
abilities.effect:
The first time this unit would be destroyed, before removing it from the battlefield, roll a dice and apply the corresponding effect:

1 - Dead
This unit is destroyed.

2-4 - The Rats Emerge
Roll a D3 for each enemy unit in combat with this unit. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on that unit equal to the roll. Then, this unit is destroyed.

5-6 - It’s Alive!
This unit is not destroyed and any remaining damage points inflicted on it have no effect. Then, Heal (D6) this unit.

warscrolls.name: Krittok Foulblade
warscrolls.fluff: Canny and cruel in equal measure, Krittok Foulblade has a profound instinct for where his minions' deaths can best serve him. He also understands with a rare clarity that even meagre displays of largesse, however falsely intended, can spur a measure of loyalty from his underlings. This same cold and calculating mindset is extended by the Clawlord to his dealings with the daemon-blade Doomfang, for the raging Verminlord trapped within its steel must be bargained with constantly if its powers are to bolster Krittok's own warrior abilities
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Foster Competition
abilities.lore: Krittok has created a system in which his armoured swarms are so desperate to earn his favour that they spend only some of their time plotting his overthrow.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to wound rolls for friendly Stormvermin units while they are wholly within 13"of this unit.

abilities.name: A Reputation For Cunning
abilities.lore: Krittok's laboriously crafted reputation for deviousness sees his thralls obey him without question.
abilities.effect: You can pick 2 different eligible units to use the 'Always Three Clawsteps Ahead' ability this phase instead of 1, but at least 1 of those units must have the VERMINUS keyword.

abilities.name: Doomfang
abilities.lore: Though Doomfang offers the ageing Krittok martial power, he must constantly haggle with its daemonic occupant, a fact that can sometimes prove distracting.
abilities.effect: This unit has STRIKE-FIRST for the rest of the turn but it cannot use commands this phase.

warscrolls.name: Lord Skreech Verminking
warscrolls.fluff: Skreech Verminking is foremost amongst the Great Horned Rat's daemonic brood. His twisted soul contains the collective knowledge of the Skaven: the shadow shifting of Eshin, the warped ingenuity of Skryre, the fury of Verminus, the plague-mastery of Pestilens and the fleshcraft of Moulder. Verminking draws upon these boons, and the fearful obedience he commands in all Skaven, to dominate the battlefield.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Monster, Wizard (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Masterclan, Verminus, Pestilens, Eshin, Skryre, Moulder

abilities.name: The Dreaded Thirteenth Spell
abilities.lore: The twisting power of the Great Horned Rat transforms men into rat-mutants that swiftly join the evil throng.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 13" to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect:
Roll 13 dice. For each 5+:

• Inflict 1 mortal damage on the target.
• You can return 1 slain model to a friendly Clanrats unit wholly within 13" of this unit.

abilities.name: Terrifying Monstrosity
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Lord Skreech has a malevolent and horrific visage that can shatter the enemy’s resolve.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy INFANTRY unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice. On a 3+:

• The target cannot use commands for the rest of the turn.
• Subtract an amount equal to the roll from the target’s control score until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: The Thirteen-headed One
abilities.lore: Lord Verminking can call upon his extensive knowledge of the Skaven clans.
abilities.effect:
Pick 1 of the following effects to apply until the start of your next turn. You cannot pick the same effect more than once per battle.

Master of Dire Sorcery: Add 1 to casting rolls for friendly MASTERCLAN WIZARDS while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

Commander of Vermin: Add 1 to charge rolls for friendly VERMINUS units while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

Knower of Warp-tech: Add 1 to hit rolls for shooting attacks made by friendly SKRYRE units while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

Deliverer of Weeping Blades: Add 1 to the Rend characteristic of melee weapons used by friendly ESHIN units while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

Bringer of Plagues: Add 1 to chanting rolls for friendly PESTILENS PRIESTS while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

Shaper of Fleshcraft: Heal (D3) each friendly MOULDER unit wholly within 13" of this unit.

warscrolls.name: Master Moulder
warscrolls.fluff: It takes an especially deranged Skaven to rise to the rank of Master Moulder. They are the overlords of the Clans Moulder, dark luminaries in the arts of flesh-grafting, each devoted to crafting ever more grotesque nightmare-beasts. Master Moulders are experts in stitching muscle and flesh into new forms, and they use warpstone to trigger mutations that twist a mortal corpus beyond recognition. Master Moulders take a warped pride in the monsters they have brought into unholy life and consider the battlefield successes of these creatures to be firmly their own.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Moulder

abilities.name: Lord of Flesh-grafting
abilities.lore: These burly commanders are the breeders, mutators and healers of the Clans Moulder.
abilities.declare: Pick another friendly MOULDER unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Heal (3) the target.

abilities.name: Tyrannical Packmaster
abilities.lore: Master Moulders use pain and terror to drive their fighting beasts into a battle frenzy.
abilities.declare: Pick another friendly MOULDER unit within this unit’s combat range to be the target.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to charge rolls for the target for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Night Runners
warscrolls.fluff: Night Runners are the lowliest acolytes of the Eshin and are seen as an entirely disposable asset. Often their fate is to be hurled into the enemy's path and provide a distraction with their messy deaths, allowing more adroit killers to carry out their subtle missions amongst the mayhem. Still, disposable as they are, Night Runners are trained and equipped to a level beyond their equivalents in the other Great Clans.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Chaos, Skaven, Eshin

abilities.name: Sneaky Infiltrators
abilities.lore: Night Runners are masters of stealth and can sneak up on almost anyone.
abilities.effect: While each model in this unit is within 1" of any terrain features, this unit cannot be targeted by shooting attacks unless the attacking model is within 9" of it.

abilities.name: Slinking Advance
abilities.lore: Night Runners scurry ahead of the main body of a Skaven army to harass and slow down the foe.
abilities.effect: This unit can use the ‘Normal Move’ ability as if it were your movement phase.

warscrolls.name: Plague Censer Bearers
warscrolls.fluff: Plague Censer Bearers rush forwards in a foaming frenzy. Maddened by disease, they swing their weapons in devastating arcs, crunching armour, flesh and bone. Few can long endure their assault or the choking clouds of plague-smog that accompany it.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Enshrouding Fumes
abilities.lore: Choking, miasmatic clouds swirl around the Plague Censer Bearers.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from hit rolls for shooting attacks that target this unit.

abilities.name: Frenzied Assault
abilities.lore: The presence of the enemy drives these crazed warriors into a terrible rage.
abilities.effect: If this unit charged in the same turn, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of its melee weapons for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Plague Monks
warscrolls.fluff: Plague Monks form the foetid congregations of the Clans Pestilens. Though inherently cowardly in the manner of all Skaven, on the battlefield, they are seized by a zealous fervour that is both bizarre and extremely unnerving to behold. Clad solely in fly-eaten robes and carrying all manner of strange religious paraphernalia and relics, they surge forwards like a mouldering landslide. Driven on by their rabid mania, they swarm against the ranks of the enemy, lashing out in a furore with blades and withered staves.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Musician (1/20), Standard Bearer (1/20), Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Spreaders of Filth and Disease
abilities.lore: Possessed with a mad zealotry, Plague Monks in their death throes will bite, claw and scratch their foe, leaving wounds that quickly fester and rot.
abilities.effect: Each time a model in this unit is slain by a combat attack and that model was in combat with the attacking unit, roll a dice. On a 6+, inflict 1 mortal damage on the attacking unit after the FIGHT ability has been resolved.

warscrolls.name: Plague Priest
warscrolls.fluff: Plague Priests shriek blasphemous prayers that unleash the dark diseases of the Great Corruptor upon their foes. Those not wasted away or withered into ooze are swiftly slain by blows from the priests’ warpstone-capped staves and smog-belching censers.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Priest (1), Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Feed On Pestilence
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a FIGHT ability for a friendly PESTILENS unit wholly within 13" of this unit
abilities.lore: Plague Priests are empowered by the spread of disease, drawing upon the foulness propagated by their zealous throngs to power their rites.
abilities.effect: Give this unit 1 ritual point.

warscrolls.name: Plague Priest on Plague Furnace
warscrolls.fluff: Plague Furnaces are mobile altars of corruption, rotting pulpits from which priests of the Pestilent Brotherhood can preach the Withered Word. Pushed by toiling packs of Plague Monks, a Plague Furnace is a ponderous construct. Its decay-eaten structure creaks and whines as it rolls forwards on grinding wheels, while thick clouds of toxic smoke emanate from the censer at its heart. This is no ordinary gas; it is laced not only with warpstone but also with the gurgled incantations of the Plague Priest who commands the Furnace.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Priest (1), War Machine, Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, the Attacks characteristic of its Great Plague Censer is 2.

abilities.name: Altar of the Great Corruptor
abilities.lore: This giant construct is venerated by the swarms of pox-ridden rats that flock to its side.
abilities.effect: Friendly PESTILENS units have WARD (6+) while they are wholly within 13" of this unit.

abilities.name: Corrupting Influence
abilities.lore: This giant construct bathes all in a thick billowing smog that is anathema to its enemies.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from ward rolls for enemy units while they are within 13" of this unit.

warscrolls.name: Plagueclaw
warscrolls.fluff: Though the Clans Pestilens prefer to spread corruption at close quarters, they possess stockpiles of their own bespoke war machines. Plagueclaw catapults are the most commonly seen of these pestilential artillery pieces. Each consists of a rotting wooden frame onto which a long throwing arm capped by an iron bowl is attached. Run-off slop from the Pestilent Brotherhood's vile experiments is poured into this container: toxic sludge filled with decaying corpses, shards of warpstone and even less palatable ingredients.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Bubonic Barrage
abilities.lore: A Plagueclaw hurls great globs of diseased filth at its targets that can send large formations into disarray.
abilities.effect: Each time this unit uses a SHOOT ability, if all of its attacks targeted the same enemy unit, after that ability has been resolved, roll a dice. If the result is equal to or less than the number of models in that enemy unit that were slain by attacks made by this unit’s Plagueclaw Catapult this phase, that enemy unit has STRIKE‑LAST for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Plaguepack
warscrolls.fluff: A Plaguepack is formed of a Plague Priest and their entourage. These fervent ratmen are devoted to the Great Corruptor and his vision of a befouled cosmos. While their master proselytises, the most favoured (or troublesome) of the pack swing a mighty plague censer, breathing deep of its noxious and blinding fumes. Alongside a Plaguepack scuttle rotten rodents, some carrying shards of warpstone crystal - a useful power source for any Plague Priest mid-catechism.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Priest (1), Infantry, Champion (1/5), Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Enshrouding Fumes
abilities.lore: Choking, miasmatic clouds swirl around a Plaguepack.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from hit rolls for shooting attacks that target this unit.

abilities.name: Plague Rat
abilities.lore: Plague rats carry shards of warpstone that can be consumed to lend the Plaguepack’s prayers more frothing urgency.
abilities.effect: This unit’s Plague rat is a token. If you make a unmodified chanting roll of 1 for this unit while its Plague rat is on the battlefield, you can remove its Plague rat from the battlefield and then re-roll that chanting roll.

warscrolls.name: Rat Ogors
warscrolls.fluff: The power of the Clans Moulder is built on the broad shoulders of the Rat Ogors. These rabid war-mutants are created by grafting nimble Skaven to the muscled bulk of ogorkind through strange cryptosorcery and infusing them with warpstone shards and unguents. These misbegotten warriors are pumped full of all manner of toxic serums designed to magnify both their regenerative properties and their natural frenzy. A mixture of pain and gnawing hunger sees them tear at enemies in a blind fury, ripping off limbs and wolfing down flesh.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Moulder

abilities.name: Unleashed Warp-fury
abilities.lore: The warpstone hammered into the flesh of these creatures crackles with volatile energies, driving them into a frenzy.
abilities.effect: Inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit. Then, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s melee weapons for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Ratling Guns
warscrolls.fluff: Ratling Guns are amongst the most commonplace of the weapon teams that emerge from the forges of the Clans Skryre. Powered by complex warp-steam batteries and activated by a hand-crank operated by the weapon's loader, Ratling Guns are notoriously difficult to aim. The sheer volume of bullets they unleash, however, can shred an enemy cohort regardless.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Weapon Team, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Hidden Weapon Team
abilities.lore: Skryre weapon teams often lurk amidst larger formations.
abilities.effect: While this unit is within the combat range of a friendly Clanrats unit that has 5 or more models, and there are no other friendly WEAPON TEAM units within that unit’s combat range, this unit is not visible to enemy units more than 13" away.

warscrolls.name: Ratling Warpblaster
warscrolls.fluff: Given their vast population and penchant for internecine warfare, Skaven appreciate the benefits of culling massed infantry. The Ratling Warpblasters were developed for expressly this purpose. A complex series of rotary cannons mounted upon a stocky wooden frame, the device is powered by a ludicrously overcharged warpstone accelerator battery. Once wheeled into place, its Warlock gunner will flick the levers that draw power from this reserve. The Warpblaster's barrels begin to revolve before spitting out a torrent of warpstone-infused missiles.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Overwhelming Fire
abilities.lore: Large enemy formations are decimated by the sheer volume of fire a Ratling Warpblaster unleashes upon them.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to hit rolls for this unit’s shooting attacks that target an enemy unit that has 10 or more models.

abilities.name: More-more Warpstone Bullets!
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: Under the dubious supervision of the Warlocks of Clans Skryre, the gunner cranks up the Ratling Warpblaster’s velocity to the max.
abilities.effect:
If this unit is within the combat range of a friendly SKRYRE HERO, this unit’s Hail of Warpstone Bullets has an Attacks characteristic of 6D6+3 instead of 3D6+3 for the rest of the turn.

However, for each unmodified hit roll of 1 for an attack made with this unit’s Hail of Warpstone Bullets, inflict 1 mortal damage on this unit after the SHOOT ability has been resolved.

warscrolls.name: Scourge of Ghyran Brood Terror
warscrolls.fluff: Ghyran has suffered terribly from the ravages of Brood Terrors, horrors created when a Master Moulder stitches himself into a hulking war-form fashioned from brass and alchemised meat. From within this two-headed titan the Master directs his minions’ attacks with frantic, jabbing motions of its weapon-limbs, before plunging headfirst into the fray to test his latest flesh-grafts upon the enemy.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Monster, Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Moulder

abilities.name: Regenerating Terror
abilities.lore: Brood Terrors are a nightmare of mutation and overwhelming strength.
abilities.effect: Heal (D6) this unit.

abilities.name: Lend a Claw
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: In a horrifying bout of lucidity and multiple flailing appendages, the remains of the Master Moulder who was stitched into this abomination exert a degree of control over the other creatures in its menagerie before swiftly falling back into a pit of insanity.
abilities.declare: Pick up to 4 other friendly non-SKRYRE MOULDER units wholly within 12" of this unit to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s Loosely Attached Bladed Limbs for the rest of the phase for each target picked. Add 1 to hit rolls for the targets’ attacks for the rest of the phase, including those made with Companion weapons.

warscrolls.name: Scourge of Ghyran Grey Seer on Screaming Bell
warscrolls.fluff: Rattling through the Ghyranite jungle on ironbound wheels comes the hellish contraption known as a Screaming Bell, a Grey Seer riding atop it and shrieking praises to the Great Horned Rat. Each bone-jarring toll of the bell invigorates nearby Skaven, healing their wounds and hastening their scurrying advance.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, War Machine, Wizard (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Masterclan

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, the Attacks characteristic of its Crushing Bulk is 4.

abilities.name: Echoes of the Vermindoom
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Any Turn
abilities.lore: As the bell rings in time with one of its counterparts in sacred Blight City, it releases a pulse of ruinous energies that invigorate the swarm.
abilities.declare: Pick each friendly SKAVEN unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Heal (D3) each target.

abilities.name: Gnaw Through Reality
abilities.lore: The Grey Seer focuses their energy to keep open a tear in reality from which fellow Skaven can pour.
abilities.declare: Make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: Until the start of your next turn, this unit counts as a friendly Gnawhole for the purposes of the ‘Gnawhole Ambush’, ‘Tunnels Through Reality’ and ‘The Endless Vermintide’ abilities.

abilities.name: The Bell Tolls
abilities.lore: With a swing and a clang, the bell doth peal; Skaven march and man-things squeal!
abilities.effect: If the current battle round number is odd, add 2" to the Move characteristic of friendly SKAVEN units while they are wholly within 13" of this unit. If the current battle round number is even, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by enemy units that target a friendly SKAVEN unit while it is wholly within 13" of this unit.

warscrolls.name: Skabbik's Plaguepack
warscrolls.fluff: Skabbik Plagueseeker is on a holy quest – holy, at least, to the rancid congregations of the Clans Pestilens. Within the Wyrdhollow, he seeks nothing less than an ingredient to one of the Great Plagues, a mythic disease with the power to change the course of history. Skabbik’s Plaguepack wetly skitter forth to bring pestilence, rot and death to the enemies of the Great Horned Rat. Should the Plague Priest’s noisome acolytes succeed in their task, the Mortal Realms themselves may be entirely reduced to a rancid, rotting mulch.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Priest (1), Infantry, Champion, Chaos, Skaven, Pestilens

abilities.name: Enshrouding Fumes
abilities.lore: Choking, miasmatic clouds swirl around a Plaguepack.
abilities.effect: Subtract 1 from hit rolls for shooting attacks that target this unit.

abilities.name: Skritter
abilities.lore: Skritter carries shards of warpstone that can be consumed to lend the Plaguepack’s prayers more frothing urgency.
abilities.effect: This unit’s Skritter is a token. If you make a chanting roll of 1 for this unit while its Skritter is on the battlefield, you can remove its Skritter from the battlefield and then re-roll that chanting roll.

warscrolls.name: Skittershank's Clawpack
warscrolls.fluff: Slynk Skittershank embodies all the devious cruelty of the Eshin clans. He prefers to ambush his foes, slashing them with twin toxin-dripping blades before scampering into the safety of the shadows, where he can watch them succumb to his agonising concoctions. At the fore of the Clawpack is Snyp Padpaw, a grizzled Clan Stryk veteran. At his side, Kreep Kinwhisper uses a cage filled with screeching ratlings to track down prey. Meanwhile, Krowch’t backstabs his foes with his razor-sharp dagger, and Skulck picks off enemies from afar with his trusty sling.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Eshin

abilities.name: Shadowy Killers
abilities.lore: Ulguan illusions and other tools of misdirection shroud Deathmasters in perpetual darkness, keeping them from harm.
abilities.effect: If the unmodified hit roll for an attack that targets this unit is 1-4, the attack fails and the attack sequence ends.

abilities.name: Sneaky Infiltrators
abilities.lore: Night Runners are masters of stealth and can sneak up on almost anyone.
abilities.effect: While each model in this unit is within 1" of a terrain feature, this unit cannot be targeted by shooting attacks unless the attacking model is within 9" of it.

warscrolls.name: Spiteclaw's Swarm
warscrolls.fluff: Skritch Spiteclaw is a particularly cunning Skaven warlord who has assembled an impressive horde of cut-throat vermin to serve his will. Though he prefers that his minions fight and die on his behalf, when cornered, Skritch becomes a whirling dervish of spiked steel and ripping claws. Skritch Spiteclaw entrusts the command and discipline of his verminous ranks to the sadistic taskmaster Krrk the Almost-trusted. Though for now he is content to spend Skaven lives at his master’s command, the foul-spirited Krrk has his own ambitious schemes for power.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Seething Swarm
abilities.lore: Clanrats overwhelm their enemies with their seemingly endless numbers – biting, stabbing and trampling their own fallen beneath their bloody claws.
abilities.effect: You can return D3 slain models to this unit.

warscrolls.name: Stormfiends
warscrolls.fluff: The Clans Moulder and Clans Skryre have long enjoyed a profitable, if fraught, alliance. Stormfiends are one of the many horrors engendered by these collaborations. In appearance, they resemble a Rat Ogor granted even greater bulk through potent warpstone serums, and they can wield various deadly Skryre firearms without tearing themselves apart through recoil.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre, Moulder

abilities.name: Grinderfist Tunnellers
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Movement Phase
abilities.lore: Grinderfists can be used to create underground tunnels.
abilities.declare: Pick this unit if it is in the tunnels below and includes any models armed with Grinderfists.
abilities.effect: Set up this unit anywhere on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Shock Gauntlets
abilities.lore: The electrical discharge created by shock gauntlets can trigger a series of linked explosions.
abilities.effect: Each time an attack made with this unit’s Shock Gauntlets scores a critical hit, that attack scores D6 hits on the target unit instead of 1. Make a wound roll for each hit.

warscrolls.name: Stormvermin
warscrolls.fluff: Unlike most Skaven warriors, who tend towards being stooped and rangy, Stormvermin are immediately identifiable by their comparative bulk and general aura of menace. Hand-picked from the most promising spawn of a litter – usually marked by having devoured many of their brood-mates – they are subjected to especially brutal training regimes by their Clawlords. This results in ratmen that are able to fight with a degree of precision and focus uncommon to their kin.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Musician (1/10), Standard Bearer (1/10), Chaos, Skaven, Verminus

abilities.name: Elite Bodyguard
abilities.lore: Every ratman of rank knows the value and prestige of Stormvermin bodyguard – they are even almost loyal…
abilities.effect: Friendly SKAVEN INFANTRY HEROES have WARD (5+) while they are within this unit’s combat range.

warscrolls.name: Thanquol on Boneripper
warscrolls.fluff: Fuelled by an addiction to warpstone and delusional self-confidence remarkable even for a Skaven, Thanquol is constantly devising new schemes to secure a seat upon the Council of Thirteen. That most of these plans go awry is irrelevant; Thanquol is a master at spinning disasters to his advantage - as well as obliterating the bodies and minds of enemies and naysayers with powerful spellcraft. Thanquol is accompanied at all times by a colossal Rat Ogor that he calls Boneripper.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Monster, Wizard (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Masterclan

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, the Attacks characteristic of its Warpfire Braziers is 4.

abilities.name: Warp-amulet
abilities.lore: Thanquol wears a thrumming green warpstone amulet, the mutating magics of which serve to meld and rapidly heal his, or Boneripper’s, flesh.
abilities.effect: Heal (D3) this unit.

abilities.name: Boneripper Rampage
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Thanquol’s monstrous Rat Ogor, Boneripper, pulverises enemies that dare stray too close.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3-5, inflict D3 mortal damage on the target. On a 6, inflict 2D3 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Terrible Madness
abilities.lore: Thanquol can inflict madness on his enemies, causing them to lash out at close allies.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 13" of this unit to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: The target cannot use commands until the start of your next turn. In addition, roll a number of dice equal to the number of models in the target unit. For each 6, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Staff of the Horned Rat
abilities.lore: Said to be crafted from scrap thieved from the Horned Rat’s lair, Thanquol’s staff thrums with malign potency.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to casting rolls for this unit.

warscrolls.name: Verminlord Corruptor
warscrolls.fluff: Avatars of foulness, a Verminlord Corruptor is vile beyond words. These rat-daemons are entities of utmost reverence to the Clans Pestilens, for they embody the Horned Rat's fascination with collapse and decay. Bloated parasites burrow through their matted fur and pestilential slimes drip from the sickle-blades known as Plaguereapers. Buboes throb across their towering frames, and the air around them becomes choked with noxious yellow fog.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Monster, Priest (1), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Pestilens

abilities.name: Plaguemaster
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Hideous parasites and diseases made flesh spill from a Verminlord Corruptor to spread their sickness.
abilities.declare: Pick up to 3 enemy units in combat with this unit to be the targets.
abilities.effect:
Roll a D3 for each target. On a 2+:

• Inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.
• Give this unit 1 ritual point.

abilities.name: Lord of Great Plagues
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Hero Phase
abilities.lore: If the raving prayers of Pestilens priests reach fever pitch across the battlefield, the Verminlord Corruptor can cause one of the legendary Great Plagues to temporarily manifest.
abilities.effect:
If the unmodified chanting roll for a friendly PESTILENS PRIEST this phase was 6, pick 1 of the following effects to apply:

Crimsonweal Curse: Pick an enemy unit within 13" of this unit to be the target. For the rest of the battle, each time the target uses a MOVE ability, inflict D3 mortal damage on it after the MOVE ability has been resolved.

The Neverplague: For the rest of the battle, you can re-roll chanting rolls for friendly PESTILENS PRIESTS.

Undulant Scourge: Pick a visible enemy unit within 13" of this unit to be the target. Inflict 2D3 mortal damage on the target.

warscrolls.name: Verminlord Deceiver
warscrolls.fluff: Verminlord Deceivers are the least seen of all their daemonic brood. They are the hidden paw and favoured assassins of the Great Horned Rat, utterly one with shadow. Even the Nightlords of the Clans Eshin may struggle to detect such a daemon's presence, save for red eyes flashing in the darkness and a susurrus of whispers slipping from empty caverns. These are deliberate ploys by the Deceivers, masters of illusory concealment and teleportation magics. If they truly do not wish to be perceived, only the most incisive observer can hope to detect them.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Monster, Wizard (1), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Eshin

abilities.name: Burst From The Shadows
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: A Verminlord Deceiver is shrouded in darkness and dread, leaping through the aether to strike at its foes in the blink of an eye.
abilities.effect:
If this unit is in combat, roll a dice. On a 4+, you can pick a point on the battlefield within 13" of this unit and within 1" of any enemy units. Remove this unit from the battlefield and set it up again within 1" of that point.

Designer’s Note: This ability allows the unit to set up in combat with a new enemy unit.

abilities.name: Lord of Assassins
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared the ‘Redeploy’ command for a friendly ESHIN INFANTRY unit wholly within 13" of this unit
abilities.lore: The skulking warriors of the Clans Eshin move like swift smoke in a Verminlord Deceiver’s presence.
abilities.effect: If you roll a 1-3 when determining the distance that unit can move, you can use a value of 4 instead.

warscrolls.name: Verminlord Warbringer
warscrolls.fluff: Warbringers are the most commonly seen of the Verminlord broods. They embody the Great Horned Rat's desire for carnage, his hunger to sweep away all that stands proud and replace it with shattered ruins through which rodents swarm. Arrogant, belligerent and territorial, Warbringers are often found dominating the Clans Verminus, who share much of their bloodthirsty world view. This stewardship, however, resembles less a protective guardian spirit and more a fell-handed tyrant bidding their screeching minions to fight with ever greater ferocity - or else face their inevitably fatal judgement.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Monster, Wizard (1), Ward (5+),  Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Verminus

abilities.name: Killing Blow
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Any Turn
abilities.lore: Warbringers drive their spike-fists into already wounded enemies, exploiting the slightest gap in their foe’s defences to deliver a bloody coup de grâce.
abilities.declare: Pick a damaged enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. If the roll is less than the number of damage points the target has, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

abilities.name: Tyrant of Battle
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: These towering monstrosities are the commanders of the seething hordes of Clans Verminus.
abilities.declare: Pick up to 2 friendly VERMINUS INFANTRY units wholly within 13" of this unit to be the targets.
abilities.effect: The targets can each use the ‘All-out Attack’ or ‘All-out Defence’ command this phase even if that command has been used by a friendly unit this phase.

warscrolls.name: Verminlord Warpseer
warscrolls.fluff: All Verminlords are conniving, as befits the daemonic progeny of the Great Horned Rat. The Warpseers, however, are manipulation given form. Their eldritch abilities go beyond those of even their fellow rat-daemons; they wheeze the stuff of sorcery, tugging at the threads of possibility and ploy with each swift lash of the tail. Engulfed by billowing gales of warp-energy, these Verminlords orchestrate the doom of armies, gleefully sending thousands of minions to their deaths to facilitate their deranged stratagems.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Monster, Wizard (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Masterclan

abilities.name: Arch-Manipulator
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Those who dare face a Warpseer find themselves utterly pre-empted and outmanoeuvred.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 4+, the target has STRIKE-LAST for the rest of the turn.

abilities.name: Tectonic Splintering
abilities.lore: Hissing invocations of ruin and collapse, the Verminlord compels the earth to break and belch forth hostile warpgales, leaving their enemies staggering.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 18" to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: Until the start of your next turn, subtract 1 from the number of dice rolled when making charge rolls for the target, to a minimum of 1.

abilities.name: Divine The Future
abilities.lore: The swirling scry-orbs of the Warpseer can show it glimpses of the future.
abilities.effect: While this unit is on the battlefield, add 2" to the distance friendly units can move when using the ‘Always Three Clawsteps Ahead’ ability.

abilities.name: Hurl Scry-orb
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: The Warpseer throws its scry-orb into the midst of the foe, where it explodes in a shattering cloud of madness and destruction.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: This unit cannot use the ‘Divine the Future’ ability for the rest of the battle. Roll a dice. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Vermintide
warscrolls.fluff: Blight City, the abominable domain of the Skaven, lurks beyond the barriers of conventional reality. Through the depths of that sub-realm swarm billions upon billions of rats, their eyes filled with malice and their teeth unnaturally sharpened by exposure to the corrupting energies of the Great Horned Rat. The Skaven excel in unpicking the logical underpinnings of creation, spreading cracks and fractures across the surface of sanity. In times of need, their sorcerers can open such a crack wide enough to allow a living wave of these rodents to spill into the realms – a grim occurrence known as a Vermintide.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Ward (6+), Chaos, Skaven

abilities.name: More-more Rats
abilities.lore: An endless tide of unholy vermin pours through the cracks in reality, their eyes aglow and their fangs unnaturally sharp.
abilities.effect: Heal (D6) this MANIFESTATION.

warscrolls.name: Vizzik Skour, Prophet of the Horned Rat
warscrolls.fluff: Created in the apocalyptic fires of the Vermindoom, Vizzik Skour is the chief priest of the Horned Rat, Lord of the Gnaw and master of the mind-shattering death frenzy. The force of this daemon's diabolic zeal is enough to crack the land and drive the Skaven swarms into a frothing madness.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Monster, Priest (2), Ward (5+), Chaos, Skaven, Daemon, Masterclan

abilities.name: Gaze of the Gnaw
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: To catch Vizzik's gaze is to be driven from one's mind by agonising raptures.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice. On a 2+, for the rest of the turn:

• If this unit is in combat with the target when the target is picked to use a FIGHT ability, all of the target's attacks must target this unit.
• Subtract 1 from hit rolls and wound rolls for the target's combat attacks that target this unit.

abilities.name: Fissures In Reality
abilities.lore: Those who resist Vizzik's will are swallowed by fang-mouthed fissures that wrench open in his presence.
abilities.declare: Pick each enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3 for each target. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

abilities.name: The Death Frenzy
abilities.lore: Such is the force of Vizzik's screeching oratory that the verminous hordes froth and spasm under his influence as mere mortals unravel to visions of their inevitable doom.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 13"of this unit or a visible friendly SKAVEN INFANTRY unit within 13" of this unit to be the target, then make a chanting roll of D6.
abilities.effect:
If the target is an enemy unit, subtract 1 from the Attacks characteristic of the target's melee weapons until the start of your next turn.

If the target is a friendly unit, it can use 2 FIGHT abilities this turn. After the first is used, however, the target has STRIKE-LAST for the rest of the turn.

If the chanting roll was 12+, you can pick 2 targets instead of 1.

abilities.name: Prophet of the Horned Rat
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
abilities.lore: Vizzik endlessly schemes to extend his god's influence - alongside his own.
abilities.effect: You can re-roll chanting rolls for this unit until the start of your next turn

warscrolls.name: Warlock Bombardier
warscrolls.fluff: Warlock Bombardiers are besotted with indiscriminate carnage. Their obsession with ballistic devastation finds realisation in the creation of Doomrockets. These are amongst the most potent, and temperamental, weapons that a single Skaven can wield, capable of blasting formations to ashes. More is always better, says the ratman mindset, and so Bombardiers gleefully strap additional warheads and power sources to their missiles. This certainly results in a satisfying explosion - though not always one that consumes the intended target...
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Explosive Payload
abilities.lore: Nothing is more satisfying to a Bombardier than seeing their doomrocket go off in the midst of a tightly packed swarm of enemies.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to hit rolls for this unit’s shooting attacks that target an enemy unit that has 10 or more models.

abilities.name: More-more Doom!
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a SHOOT ability for this unit, it was not set up this turn and it has not used a MOVE ability this turn
abilities.lore: An extra doomrocket warhead can be attached to the payload if the wielder dares.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, set the Damage characteristic of its Doomrocket to D3+3 for the rest of the turn. On a 1, inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit.

warscrolls.name: Warlock Engineer
warscrolls.fluff: The most common class of Warlocks are known simply as Engineers. These are responsible for the construction and operation of the many mass-produced wonder weapons of the Clans Skryre. Less inclined to face their foes head on, many Warlock Engineers carry ranged weapons of their own creation, with warplock muskets being a perennial favourite. Of course, the Engineers cannot help but attempt to push these weapons to their limits, thoroughly convinced of their own genius - until the musket detonates in their claws, that is.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Sniper-master
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: No enemy is safe from the warp-laced bullets of a Warlock Engineer and his underlings.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy HERO to be the target.
abilities.effect: For the rest of the turn, this unit and friendly Warplock Jezzails units wholly within 13" of this unit can ignore the effects of the ‘Guarded Hero’ ability (Core Rules, 25.0) when picking the target for their shooting attacks.

abilities.name: More-more Warp Energy!
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a SHOOT ability for this unit, it was not set up this turn and it has not used a MOVE ability this turn
abilities.lore: The Engineer overcharges their weapon with volatile energy.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, set the Damage characteristic of this unit’s Warplock Musket to 3 for the rest of the turn. On a 1, inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit.

warscrolls.name: Warlock Galvaneer
warscrolls.fluff: A Warplock Galvaneer is a connoisseur of electrically charged annihilation. These twitchy maniacs are obsessed with channelling the voltaic energies that course through the veins of the Dark Innovator, and they see the battlefield as the perfect arena in which to test their latest creations. Wielding battery-powered warpvolt obliterators, they scamper into the fray, their weapons spitting crackling arcs of warp-corrupted lightning that scorch flesh and turn even heavily armoured foes into jerking, smoking corpses.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Lightning Master
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Your Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: None are better than a Warlock Galvaneer at engineering storms of electrical carnage.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly Warpvolt Scourgers unit within this unit's combat range to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, set the Attacks characteristic of the target's Warpvolt Scourgers to 10 for the rest of the turn.

abilities.name: More-More Warpvolt Doom!
abilities.lore: This warpvolt weapon unleashes an all-consuming wave of sparking death that vaporises nearby enemies.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit that had any damage points allocated to it this turn by attacks made with this unit's Warpvolt Obliterator to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3 for each other enemy unit within the target's combat range. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on that enemy unit equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Warp Lightning Cannon
warscrolls.fluff: Warp Lightning Cannons are the most infamous creations of the Clans Skryre. A dense warpstone core is attached to a long metallic barrel, etched with runes that magnify power channelled along it. Said power is focused in the warpstone 'tip' of the cannon before being discharged in a bolt of sizzling energy. The erratic nature of warpstone ensures that even the most skilled Skaven artillerist cannot accurately determine how much power will be exerted when the weapon is fired. Usually, they must simply pick their moment and hope for the best.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Warp Lightning Blast
abilities.lore: A Warp Lightning Cannon fires massive bolts of warp lightning that disintegrate any who are struck by them.
abilities.effect: Each attack made with this weapon in a single phase must target the same enemy unit. Each hit inflicts 1 mortal damage on the target and the attack sequence ends.

abilities.name: More-more Warp Lightning!
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: Warlock Engineer can increase the power output of a Warp Lightning Cannon at the risk of harming the weapon and its crew.
abilities.effect:
If this unit is within the combat range of a friendly SKRYRE HERO, add 6 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s Warp Lightning Blast for the rest of the turn.

However, for each unmodified hit roll of 1 for an attack made with this unit’s Warp Lightning Blast, inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit after the SHOOT ability has been resolved.

warscrolls.name: Warp Lightning Vortex
warscrolls.fluff: Warp lightning is often used for the crude but satisfying purpose of destruction, but it possesses more subtle qualities also. By hurling a clawful of warpstone shards onto the earth and rasping the necessary invocations, a Skaven sorcerer can see them grow into sizable prisms, linked by chains of crackling warp lightning. The space within these arcane chains becomes a swirling vortex of corruptive magical energy. Any trapped within this zone find their strength sapped and waning, as if dragged out by the flickering tongues of lightning.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Ward (6+), Chaos, Skaven

abilities.name: Warp Vortex
abilities.lore: The sheer destructive anarchy that surrounds a Warp Lightning Vortex slows the progress of warriors caught in its midst.
abilities.effect: Subtract 2 from run rolls and charge rolls for enemy units while they are within 6" of this MANIFESTATION. In addition, if an enemy unit passes across this MANIFESTATION and/or the round-cornered triangle formed by drawing a line around all the bases of the MANIFESTATION’s parts, inflict D3 mortal damage on that enemy unit after the MOVE ability has been resolved.

abilities.name: Warp Lightning Bolts
abilities.lore: Coruscating bolts of warp lightning leap outwards from the Warp Lightning Vortex, obliterating those nearby.
abilities.declare: If this MANIFESTATION was not set up this turn, pick each enemy unit within 6" of this MANIFESTATION to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice for each target. On a 4+, inflict D3 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Multiple Parts
abilities.effect: When a number of damage points equal to this MANIFESTATION's Health characteristic are allocated to it, this MANIFESTATION is destroyed and all its parts are removed from play.

warscrolls.name: Warp-Grinder
warscrolls.fluff: The primary function of a Warp-Grinder is as an arcane reality-borer. Manoeuvred by straining thralls and operated by Warlocks who have taken their obsession with undermining their foes to terrifying extremes, these bulky constructs project powerful - if erratic - blasts of energy to punch through the skin of reality. Using these devices, the Skaven can open gnawholes or tunnel into vulnerable regions of a battlefield to allow screeching warrior swarms to set upon enemies from quarters unforeseen.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Warp-ambush
abilities.lore: As the Warp-Grinder's tip tears open the realms, Skaven warriors burst forth shrieking and with blades drawn.
abilities.declare: Pick this unit if it is in the tunnels below, then pick an enemy unit more than 6" from all other enemy units to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 4+, set up this unit within 3" of the target and more than 6" from all other enemy units. Then, set up the unit that was in the tunnels below with this unit within 3" of the target and more than 6" from all other enemy units.

abilities.name: Tunnel Skulkers
abilities.lore: A Warp-Grinder can be used to tunnel through reality, allowing the Skaven to strike from unexpected quarters.
abilities.declare: Pick this unit and up to 1 friendly non-MONSTER SKAVEN unit if those units have not been deployed.
abilities.effect: Set up those units in reserve in the tunnels below. They have now been deployed.

warscrolls.name: Warpfire Throwers
warscrolls.fluff: Within the voluminous barrel of a Warpfire Thrower sloshes a particularly incendiary and evil concoction. When the Skaven gunner depresses a trigger, this liquid is fed through crude piping to spew out of a brass nozzle, igniting on contact with the air to produce sheets of blinding green flame. So deadly is this compound that it cannot be doused through conventional means; those whom it strikes can only burn to death in agony as the fire leaps across tightly packed ranks of infantry.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Weapon Team, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Hidden Weapon Team
abilities.lore: Skryre weapon teams often lurk amidst larger formations.
abilities.effect: While this unit is within the combat range of a friendly Clanrats unit that has 5 or more models, and there are no other friendly WEAPON TEAM units within that unit’s combat range, this unit is not visible to enemy units more than 13" away.

warscrolls.name: Warplock Jezzails
warscrolls.fluff: Long-range warfare is a respected art amongst the Skaven; it is, after all, the method of combat least likely to involve personal danger. Skilled snipers amongst the Clans Skryre take up Warplock Jezzails, from which they can spit death from the rearmost ranks. Two ratmen are needed to carry a Jezzail; the second Skaven makes themselves useful by clutching a pavise shield that props up the heavy rifle and provides a measure of defence against return fire.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Warpstone Snipers
abilities.lore: Having set up the Warplock Jezzail in position, the gunner can wait for the perfect moment to fire their shot.
abilities.effect: If this unit has not used a MOVE ability this turn and was not set up this turn, add 6" to the Range characteristic of this unit's Warplock Jezzails for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Warpvolt Scourgers
warscrolls.fluff: One of the many forms of weapon forged in the hellish foundries of the Warlocks, Warpvolt Scourgers channel the power of warpstone into volatile warp lightning, which travels between twin orb-like conductors before leaping forth to bring voltaic destruction to the enemy. Flesh and soul make perversely fine conductors for warp lightning and foes who are packed in tight are sure to be caught in a Scourger's fury, blasting them to oblivion and leaving them fatally convulsing.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Weapon Team, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Hidden Weapon Team
abilities.lore: Skryre weapon teams often lurk amidst larger formations.
abilities.effect: While this unit is within the combat range of a friendly Clanrats unit that has 5 or more models, and there are no other friendly WEAPON TEAM units within that unit's combat range, this unit is not visible to enemy units more than 13" away.

warscrolls.name: Zikkit's Tunnelpack
warscrolls.fluff: Zikkit Rockgnaw is one of the crazed Warlocks of the Clans Skryre and obsessed with undermining his enemies – in the most literal sense. He has developed an eclectic arsenal of apparatus for the purpose of digging beneath a battlefield and appearing when least expected, including rat-mounted bombs and his own portable warp-grinder. Perhaps the most deadly weapon in his Tunnepack’s possession, though, is the miniaturised Doomwheel controlled, loosely speaking, by his apprenctice, Rittak Verm.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Infatry, Chaos, Skaven, Skryre

abilities.name: Tunnelpack Ambush
abilities.lore: With a deafening crack, the earth splits and the Tunnelpack scurry forth into battle.
abilities.declare: Pick this unit if it is drilling beneath the surface.
abilities.effect: Set up this unit anywhere on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Ka-Boom!
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: Tik Tik carries an explosive charge that makes a mockery of armour and carefully planned charges alike.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: This unit’s Tik Tik is a token. If this unit’s Tik Tik is on the battlefield, remove it from the battlefield and roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll and the target has STRIKE-LAST for the rest of the turn.

abilities.name: Tunneling Team
abilities.lore: Zikkit’s Tunnelpack often turn up when least expected
abilities.effect: Set up this unit in reserve drilling beneath the surface. It has now been deployed.

rules.name: Prized Creations
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Hero Phase
rules.lore: Moulder warbeasts are studded with warpstone crystals and pumped full of vile serums that spur their battle-rage – at the occasional cost of overtaxing their forms.
rules.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly non-HERO MOULDER units to be the targets.
rules.effect:
Roll a dice for each target and apply the corresponding effect:

1-2 - Self-destructive Fury
Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target.

3-4 - Rabid Infusion
Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of the target’s melee weapons until the start of your next turn.

5-6 - Blinded by Frenzy
In addition to the effect of ‘Rabid Infusion’, the target has WARD (5+) until the start of your next turn.

rules.name: Corrupted Earth
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Any Turn
rules.lore: The Clans Pestilens are relentless in advancing the spread of plague and corruption.
rules.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly PESTILENS units that are in combat to be the targets.
rules.effect:
For each target:

• Make a pile-in move.
• Then, pick an enemy unit in combat with the target and roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on that enemy unit equal to the roll.

rules.name: Claw-picked
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Combat Phase
rules.lore: The Stormvermin and Clanrats of a Verminus Claw‑horde are amongst the most ferocious of all ratmen.
rules.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly VERMINUS units that charged this turn to be the targets.
rules.effect: Add 1 to the Rend characteristic of the targets’ melee weapons for the rest of the turn.

rules.name: Will of the Horned Rat
rules.lore: Although they tower over the rest of the swarm, Verminlords are as craven and cunning as any Skaven – in truth even more so – and will readily use their underlings as fodder to protect their own hides.
rules.effect:
While a friendly SKAVEN DAEMON is within the combat range of a friendly non-HERO SKAVEN INFANTRY unit:

• That SKAVEN DAEMON has WARD (4+).
• Each time you make a successful ward roll for that SKAVEN DAEMON, allocate 1 mortal damage on a friendly non-HERO SKAVEN INFANTRY unit within that unit’s combat range after the damage sequence for that unit has been resolved. (ward rolls cannot be made for these damage points).

rules.name: Backstabbing Allies
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Reaction: You declared the ‘Redeploy’ command for a friendly SKAVEN unit
rules.lore: The Skaven often form uneasy alliances between clans, but none of them want to suffer the brunt of the fighting when the enemy draws near.
rules.effect: Pick up to 2 other friendly SKAVEN units that are not in combat and are wholly within 13" of the unit using the ‘Redeploy’ command to be the targets. Each target must have at least one of the following keywords: VERMINUS, SKRYRE, MOULDER, PESTILENS, ESHIN. After that ‘Redeploy’ command has been resolved, each of the targets can immediately use the ‘Redeploy’ command in an order of your choice without any command points being spent.

rules.name: Skryre Prototypes
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Shooting Phase
rules.lore: The fell contraptions wielded by these ratmen were created by the Clans Skryre’s most ingenious weaponsmiths.
rules.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly SKRYRE units to be the targets.
rules.effect:
Roll a dice for each target and apply the corresponding effect:

1 - Kaboom!
Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target.

2-5 - More Power!
Add 1 to wound rolls for the target’s shooting attacks for the rest of the turn.

6 - More-more Power!
In addition to the effect of ‘More Power!’, add 1 to the Rend characteristic of the target’s ranged weapons for the rest of the turn.

artefacts.name: Warpstone Innards
artefacts.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
artefacts.lore: A 'gift' from Thanquol, these warpstone-studded organs have been inserted into a prized warbeast to augment its power.
artefacts.declare: Pick a friendly non-HERO MUTATED MENAGERIE MONSTER unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the target.
artefacts.effect: Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of the target's melee weapons for the rest of the battle. However, at the end of each turn, allocate D3 damage points to the target.

artefacts.name: Warpstone Charm
artefacts.lore: This foul talisman radiates mutating energy that can be directed at an enemy unit to erode their armour.
artefacts.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
artefacts.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, subtract 1 from save rolls for the target for the rest of the turn.

artefacts.name: Foulhide
artefacts.lore: Fashioned from the flensed flesh of Rat Ogors and soaked in cloying alchemical agents, this stinking armour sticks to its wearer like a bloated second skin and regrows as fast as it can be hacked apart.

artefacts.name: Skavenbrew
artefacts.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Any Combat Phase
artefacts.lore: This foul concoction, brewed from blood and warpstone, is dispensed to expendable underlings to drive them into a short-lived but devastating killing frenzy.
artefacts.declare: Pick a friendly non-HERO SKAVEN INFANTRY unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the target.
artefacts.effect: Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target. Then, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of the target’s melee weapons for the rest of the turn.

artefacts.name: Icon of Great-total Supremacy
artefacts.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
artefacts.lore: Within this jagged brass reliquary lies a cutting from the Horned Rat's whiskers. It exerts a natural hold over the Skaven, drawing frothing warriors to it.
artefacts.effect: You can return up to D3 slain models to each friendly GNAWHORDE INFANTRY unit with a Health characteristic of up to 3.

heroicTraits.name: Pack Tactics
heroicTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Any Combat Phase
heroicTraits.lore: Though insane with frenzy, the beasts of Thanquol's menagerie retain some of their predatory swarming instincts..
heroicTraits.declare: Pick up to 2 friendly non-HERO MUTATED MENAGERIE MONSTER units wholly within 13" of this unit to be the targets.
heroicTraits.effect: The targets can each use the 'All-out Attack' or 'All-out Defence' command this phase even if that command has been used by a friendly unit this phase.

heroicTraits.name: Skilled Manipulator
heroicTraits.lore: This Skaven warlord is particularly devious and selfserving, deftly ensuring that their minions are always conveniently positioned between themselves and potential threats.
